snippet: An exhibit at the National Portrait Gallery consists of portraits of famous people, such as Gene Autry and Lucille Ball, whom we usually see in black and white.
abstract: Neil Genzlinger Critic's Notebook discusses photographs from the exhibition In Vibrant Color: Vintage Celebrity Portraits From the Harry Warnecke Studio at the National Portrait Gallery in Washington, DC.
lead_paragraph: An exhibit at the National Portrait Gallery consists of portraits of famous people, such as Gene Autry and Lucille Ball, whom we usually see in black and white.

headline.seo: ‘In Vibrant Color’ - Harry Warnecke - National Portrait Gallery
headline.main: Adding a Colorful Gloss to a Black-and-White World
headline.print_headline: Adding a Colorful Gloss To a Black-and-White World
